page.title: 16 The Rolls Connection.
page.content: Today,Lt.Col.J.C.E. Harding-Rolls resides at Rockfield House to the north west of Monmouth.The Rolls family has had an important and long connection with the area. In 1887 the Rolls Hall was given to the town of Monmouth by Lord Llangatock the son of J.E.W. Rolls.It was designed as a place of entertainment and where important meetings could be held.Today,it is a 'Bingo' hall and on Saturday evenings is venue for discos (dances). One famous son of the Rolls family was Charles Stewart Rolls of the Hendre who died in a flying accident at Bournemouth in 1910.His statue can be seen in Agincourt Square in the centre of Monmouth.Rolls was a pioneer of automobile travel and his connection with Henry Royce is world famous.There are annual displays of these cars.
